name: Les Chambres de Camille

reviews.text: This B&B is situated in a lovely area of Bordeaux and is housed in a beautiful and lovingly renovated traditional Bordelaise house . The rooms are decorated in a modern but sympathetic style and are surprisingly spacious for Bordeaux. Francois and Chantel, the owners, clearly love what they do and are charming and welcoming.
reviews.title: Stunning B&B

reviews.text: An early flight forced me to miss breakfast but Francois was up with the sun to ensure I had a decent cup of coffee before my departure!
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: FABULOUS B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovingly and sympatheticly restored building. Each room has an individual style. It is very clean and comfortable. The quality and attention to detail shines through, Towels are fluffy,beds are comfortable and breakfasts are delicious.Our hosts were charming and so willing to help and nothing was too much trouble The pool was so welcome after a hot day in the city. The only down side is no air con but really this would only be needed for a few days a year. I look forward to return trips. Many thanks for everything
reviews.title: Lovely B & B in Bordeaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Les Chambres de Camille in May to spend our last 2 nights holiday in Bordeaux before flying home. The proprietors, Francois and Chantal were so welcoming ,friendly and helpful. The rooms were absolutely delightful, ours Miroir d'eauu , overlooked the little courtyard and small pool at the rear of the property. Everything was extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable, there was tea & coffee in the room and the bathroom had a lovely big shower. The proprietors have put a lot of thought and effort into making the hotel a delightful place to stay with lots of lovely little extras!
reviews.title: An oasis of calm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very lovely B & B and although it may see like it is a bit out of the way the tram gets you quickly and easily to the main part of Bordeaux. The room was very cute - we had the red one and the bed was OK. We stayed in Bordeaux to go on a wine tour and although I don't think that they have a listing on trip advisor we took one called "Tours 33" and it was as wonderful as the B & B. There are not any restaurants close to the B&B but take my word for it and do not be afraid to take the tram which is only a 4 or 5 minute walk down the street and gets you right to the heart of Bordeaux. Some day I would like to visit Bordeaux again and perhaps see some more wineries and I would certainly stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Lovely Bordeaux B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B has it all. The host and his wife really make you feel welcome. They speak English very well and we had many interesting conversations. The location is excellent. Quay des Chartrons and the centre of Bordeaux are within 15-20 minutes walking distance and the tram is just a few hundred meters away. We did not have any problem finding free parking on nearby streets. The rooms are newly renovated to a very high standard. Breakfast was excellent with home made bread and cakes every day. It is served in the dining room giving you a good opportunity to talk to the other guests. This was the first time we stayed in a B&B in France but based on the expericence from this and other B&B's we stayed in on this trip we will definitely prefer to stay in B&B's on future trips to France.
reviews.title: You won't find a better B&B in Bordeaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from France and had a wonderful trip. We spent two nights here on Camille Godard. The room (and the entire home) is lovely and decorated beautifully. Comfortable bed, great shower, lots of little touches like bottled water and helpful tour guide magazines. Our hosts couldn't have been nicer and spoke such wonderful English. (This was welcome as our French is horrible!) The B&B is in a great location making walking into town center an easy stroll. We'd come back again.
reviews.title: Delightful Surprise

reviews.text: I stayed in this B and B for 2 nights with my family and we had the best experience. The hosts obviously love what they do and do anything possible to be helpful. This elegant house has been decorated with a lot of care, taste and love. The rooms are very pleasant and the bathrooms contemporary and extremely clean.
reviews.title: Refined and warm experience walking distance to the heart of Bordeaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chantal is a great cook and and she obviously puts a lot of thought in preparing breakfast in the morning which is so much better than the average French ones.
reviews.title: Relaxed charm and style

description: 3 charming guestrooms only 15 minutes walk from the touristic and historical center of Bordeaux. Tram station at 200 meters of the house. You will apreciate this old XIXth Century house of typical Bordeaux architecture. The guestrooms are spacious and have been decorated with refinement. They all have private bathrooms, equipped with toilet, shower or bath, hand-basin and hair drier. Breakfast included in price. Free wifi internet connection.
